page.title: 15Rogart - Farming
page.content: Davoch Farm, farmed and owned by the Murray family is situated in the Rogart Valley. It is 85 acres of arable land. On the hillside, it also has 500 acres of poor land. The land supports 30-50 head of cattle and 200 sheep. To feed the animals in winter, hay and turnips are grown. Any other food needed, is bought in. The family have all the necessary implements. Ten years ago, a new steading was built and soon there will be a new hay shed. The Fleet forms a boundary of Davoch Farm. Over the years a bank of ground has been built up, so Davoch does not suffer from flooding when the river is in spate. In the near future, Mr Murray proposes to sell his cattle and turn the farm into a sheep-rearing business.
